Name.BusinessNameLine1: Edgewater Systems for Balanced Living Inc

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To establish and operate a comprehensive mental health center that will provide services directed to the treatment and prevention of mental illness and other psychiatric disabilities.
IRS990.MissionDescription: To establish and operate a comprehensive mental health center that will provide services directed to the treatment and prevention of mental illness and other psychiatric disabilities.
IRS990.Description: THERE ARE FOUR MAJOR SERVICE PROGRAMS AT EDGEWATER SYSTEMS FOR BALANCED LIVING; MEDICAL SERVICES, FAMILY & YOUTH SERVICES, ADDICTION SERVICES AND MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES.MEDICAL SERVICES: THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES IN DEPTH MEDICAL CARE. FAMILY & YOUTH SERVICES: THIS PROGRAM OFFERS DIAGNOSTIC EVALUATION, INDIVIDUAL TREATMENT, FAMILY TREATMENT, AND CONSULTATION. THE PROGRAM COMPONENTS INCLUDE THE OUTPATIENT PROGRAMS. ADDICTION SERVICES: ICAN PROGRAM AND THELMA MARSHALL CHILDREN'S OVERUSE AND MISUSE OF DRUGS AND ALCOHOL. IT INCLUDES NEW INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WITH PROBLEMS RELATING TO AN ADDICTION. THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES HELP TO LIFE CENTER, A METHADONE MAINTENANCE PROGRAM.LONG MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES: THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES COMPREHENSIVE COMMUNITY SUPPORT FOR SERIOUSLY AND PERSISTENTLY MENTALLY ILL PERSONS WHO HAVE HAD A HISTORY OF FREQUENT AND/OR TERM HOSPITALIZATION. IT ALSO CONSISTS OF AN ADULT TERM HOSPITALIZATION.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: ASSISTANCE on behalf of EDGEWATER'S CLIENTS for LABORATORY SERVICES, PERSONAL CARE, AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Specific assistance is provided on behalf of Clients on an as needed basis. Client's financial information is verified and maintained by the business office.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Employee of Edgewater Systems for Balanced Living, Inc.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Organization is set up as a not-for-profit corporation with a board of directors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The process of reviewing the Form 990 includes a detailed review of the Form 990 by the Finance department. The governing body reviews the final Form 990 including requested schedules, as ultimately filed with the IRS, prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Board members complete an annual survey listing any conflicts that may arise. During meeting, the member will abstain from voting on related issues.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board Chairman requests an overview of the past year, accompanied by goals and objectives for the new contract year from the CEO. Each Board member will complete the CEO performance appraisal rating form within 30 days of receiving those materials. An Executive Committee of the Board for purposes of conducting an evaluation of the CEO's performance will then be called by the Board Chairman. The Board President and the Executive Committee will then present a summary with an overall rating, a narrative and salary compensation recommendation in writing to the full board at the next scheduled meeting.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization does not make the governing documents, conflict of interest policy, or financial statements available to the public.
The board of directors assumes responsibility for oversight of the financial statement audit and no processes have changed from the prior year.
